alert.note: Alert for Big Belt, Bridger and Castle Mountains; Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Gates of the Mountains; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Southern High Plains; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 6:42PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong outflow winds will impact portions of east central Lewis and Clark, southeastern Teton, western Chouteau and western Cascade Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 641 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong outflow boundary along a line extending from 6 miles west of Fairfield to near Fort Shaw to near Cascade to near Wolf Creek. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Cascade, Fairfield, Dutton, Fort Shaw, Fort Shaw, Power, Vaughn, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Sun River, Tower Rock State Park, Collins, Craig, Ulm, and Simms. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Big Belt, Bridger and Castle Mountains; Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Gates of the Mountains; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Southern High Plains; Western and Central Chouteau County
